ecom_db.name: E-Commerce Database
ecom_db.description: This database contains all e-commerce related data including customer orders, products, and user information. Use this database for queries about: orders, order status, order processing, customers, users, products, inventory, stock, pricing, and sales.

tables.users: Contains customer/user information including names, emails, and registration dates
tables.products: Contains product catalog with names, prices, and stock quantities
tables.orders: Contains order information including user who placed the order, product ordered, quantity, order status (pending/processing/completed/cancelled), and order dates

common_queries: What products are low in stock?

project_db.name: Project Management Database
project_db.description: This database contains project management and team collaboration data including employees, projects, and tasks. Use this database for queries about: employees, team members, projects, project status, tasks, task assignments, work items, and employee roles.

tables.employees: Contains employee information including names, roles, and email addresses
tables.projects: Contains project information with names and status (active/completed/on_hold)
tables.tasks: Contains task details including which project they belong to, who they're assigned to, descriptions, and status (todo/in_progress/done)

common_queries: How many tasks are in progress?
What tasks are assigned to a specific employee?

selection_guidelines.step_1: Read the user's question carefully and identify the main subject/entity being queried
selection_guidelines.step_2: Check which database's keywords match the subject in the query
selection_guidelines.step_3: If the query mentions 'orders', 'products', 'customers', 'users', or 'sales', use ecom_db
selection_guidelines.step_4: If the query mentions 'employees', 'projects', 'tasks', or 'assignments', use project_db
selection_guidelines.step_5: When in doubt, check both database schemas and pick the one with relevant tables
